title: How to Make Strawberry Terrine

steps.headline: Place the strawberries into the blender.
Place the strawberry puree into a saucepan.
steps.description: Add the Grand Marnier, lemon juice and agar agar. Bring to the boil for half a minute, then remove from the heat.

steps.headline: Whip the cream.
steps.description: Gently add the whipped cream to the strawberry puree.

steps.headline: Line the terrine mould with the baking (parchment) paper.
Slice the remaining strawberries and line these along the sides of the mould.
Pour the strawberry puree into the mould.
steps.description: Put it into the refrigerator and leave to set for at least four hours.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Slice and serve on a dessert place. Pour a strawberry coulis over the top for added sweetness. A dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of ice cream will complement this dessert well.

text: Place the strawberries into the blender. Add the icing sugar. Puree. Place the strawberry puree into a saucepan. Add the Grand Marnier, lemon juice and agar agar. Bring to the boil for half a minute, then remove from the heat. Whip the cream. Gently add the whipped cream to the strawberry puree. Line the terrine mould with the baking (parchment) paper.  Slice the remaining strawberries and line these along the sides of the mould.  Pour the strawberry puree into the mould. Put it into the refrigerator and leave to set for at least four hours. Serve. Slice and serve on a dessert place. Pour a strawberry coulis over the top for added sweetness. A dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of ice cream will complement this dessert well. Finished.
